item.title: Noone can use the pavement, you have to walk into the road, 13th September
item.description:
This is attached to flat 2 Charles covenly road. Danger to pedestrians, access to the pavement is blocked as the trees are almost touching the ground. No one pushing a baby, or using a wheel chair can pass. Blind or partially blind will have difficulties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moody Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Rotting fallen apples, 13th September
item.description:

item.title: Graffiti sprayed at Abbey Close SW9 by Lansdowne Green UKPC Carpark. The graffiti is offensive., 13th September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed at Abbey Close SW9. The graffiti is very visible sprayed at the Lansdowne Green UKPC carpark. Some of the graffiti is offensive. It is against a brick wall and corner area. Please can the graffiti be removed. It has been up for approximately five months or more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allen Edwards Drive, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. Also known as Thornton Street., 13th September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. I have already reported about getting the graffiti removed on several occasions buy yet it still remains The latest reference number I was given was 453353. Please could the graffiti be painted over. The wording is fairly large done against the front and side of the shutter. The graffiti has been up for over a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296-298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A massive tree needs to be, 13th September
item.description:
The tree outside of our flat hasn't been maintained since the residents moved in 2012 as far as we know.As it's a massive tree, a drainage company pointed out that the roots are fibrous and are intruding through the joint at the trap located at the front of the property. Our property has experienced some significant subsidence, a recent inspection suggested that the tree's roots are the cause; cracks on the driveway and all levels of the property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Union Flags on crossing poles, 13th September
item.description:
Could not get a picture as was on bus, but someone has tied Union Flags to the poles of the small zebra crossing between Charlton Park Academy School and entrance to Maryon Wilson Animal Park. This is the crossing with the old fashioned yellow Belisha Beacon lights just before the turn into LittleHeath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
